intro: Vittadinia blackii, commonly known as the blackii everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind, aiding in its propagation. Vittadinia blackii typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as coastal dunes. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in gardens, although it is considered a rare and threatened species in its natural range.
